qas.question: What event did the American revolution cause?

answers.text: British monarchy itself to become the sovereign United States of America.

qas.question: How did the Thirteen Colonies become The United States Of America?

answers.text: overthrow the governance of the Parliament of Great Britain, and then reject the British monarchy

qas.question: Why did the United States form independent states?

answers.text: the colonies first rejected the authority of the Parliament to govern them without representation

qas.question: Who did the Second Continental Congress join together against?
What is the armed conflict form 1775 to 1783 is known as?

context: Beginning the Age of Revolution, the American Revolution and the ensuing political upheaval during the last half of the 18th century saw the Thirteen Colonies of North America <a1_0>overthrow the governance of the Parliament of Great Britain, and then reject the <a0_0>British monarchy<a1_0/> itself to become the sovereign United States of America.<a0_0/> In this period <a2_0>the colonies first rejected the authority of the Parliament to govern them without representation<a2_0/>, and formed self-governing independent states. The Second Continental Congress then joined together against <a3_0>the British<a3_0/> to defend that self-governance in the armed conflict from 1775 to 1783 known as the <a4_0>American Revolutionary War<a4_0/> (also called American War of Independence).
